notes.text: This CSAF advisory was extracted from unstructured data and may contain inaccuracies. If you notice any errors, please reach out to the designated contact at CISA CSAF: central@cisa.dhs.gov

notes.text: Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code, crash the system, or write controlled content to the target system.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: Chemical, Commercial Facilities, Energy, Food and Agriculture, Transportation Systems, Water and Wastewater Systems
notes.title: Critical infrastructure sectors

notes.text: NCCIC recommends users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of this vulnerability. Specifically, users should:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: NCCIC reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.NCCIC also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS-CERT web page. Several recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS-CERT website in the Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.Organizations observing any suspected malicious activity should follow their established internal procedures and report their findings to NCCIC for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: No known public exploits specifically target these vulnerabilities.
notes.title: Exploitability

document.title: LCDS - Leão Consultoria e Desenvolvimento de Sistemas Ltda ME LAquis SCADA

revision_history.summary: ICSA-18-289-01 LCDS - Leao Consultoria e Desenvolvimento de Sistemas LTDA ME LAquis SCADA

product.name: Smart Security Manager: Versions 4.1.0.3870 and prior

branches.name: LCDS - LeÃ£o Consultoria e Desenvolvimento de Sistemas LTDA ME

notes.text: An untrusted pointer dereference vulnerability has been identified, which may allow remote code execution.CVE-2018-17893 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 5.6 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:L).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: LCDS recommends that users update to Version 4.1.0.4114, which can be found at the following location:

notes.text: Several out-of-bounds read vulnerabilities have been identified, which may allow remote code execution.CVE-2018-17895 has been assigned to these vulnerabilities. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.3 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:L).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: LCDS recommends that users update to Version 4.1.0.4114, which can be found at the following location:

notes.text: Several integer overflow to buffer overflow vulnerabilities have been identified, which may allow remote code execution.CVE-2018-17897 has been assigned to these vulnerabilities. A CVSS v3 base score of 5.6 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:L).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: LCDS recommends that users update to Version 4.1.0.4114, which can be found at the following location:

cwe.name: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')

notes.text: A path traversal vulnerability has been identified, which may allow remote code execution.CVE-2018-17899 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 6.3 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:L).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: LCDS recommends that users update to Version 4.1.0.4114, which can be found at the following location:

notes.text: When processing project files the application fails to sanitize user input prior to performing write operations on a stack object, which may allow an attacker to execute code under the current process.CVE-2018-17901 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 5.3 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:L/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:L).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: LCDS recommends that users update to Version 4.1.0.4114, which can be found at the following location:

notes.text: Several stack-based buffer overflow vulnerabilities have been identified, which may allow remote code execution.CVE-2018-17911 has been assigned to these vulnerabilities. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.8 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:L/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary
